title: How a ‘Typical Nerd’ Became a Leading Luxury-Fashion Seller
sub_head: Farfetch founder José Neves started out developing inventory software for clothing-company suppliers. He now runs a massive online-sales platform for brands like Gucci, Prada and Versace.
body:
José Neves has spent the past 15 years building Farfetch Ltd. into a leading online marketplace for luxury products, but his career in luxury started almost by accident.
An avid coder since he was 8 years old, Mr. Neves said his sole ambition as a young man was to be Portugal’s answer to Bill Gates or Steve Jobs and run a software company. He founded his first tech business when he was 19, only to stumble into luxury when developing inventory software in the mid-1990s for Portuguese suppliers of such brands.
